subject: Web3
title: Crypto Tax Basics
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Crypto Tax Basics.

hook.text: In the US, every crypto trade, swap, or purchase is a taxable event. Sell Bitcoin at a profit? You owe capital gains tax.

buildup.text: Short-term gains are taxed as income, up to 37%. Long-term holdings over a year get lower rates, between 0% and 20%.

discovery.text: Even swapping Ethereum for a stablecoin triggers a tax event. The IRS treats it as selling one asset and buying another.

twist.text: Tracking hundreds of trades across multiple wallets and exchanges is a nightmare. Most crypto users are technically non-compliant.

climax.text: Crypto taxes are real but enforcement is catching up slowly. The IRS is investing heavily in blockchain analytics.

punchline.text: Every swap, every trade, every purchase. The IRS considers it all taxable.

quiz.question: How does the IRS treat swapping one cryptocurrency for another?
options: As a taxable event equivalent to selling one asset and buying another
